title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2.6 - Licensing for more than one employer at single pier; employment by one employer at several piers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2.6 - Licensing for more than one employer at single pier; employment by one employer at several piers

State Regulations

No person will be licensed as a pier superintendent or hiring
agent for more than one employer, except: (a) at a single pier or waterfront terminal; or
(b) where the employers are
licensed as stevedores pursuant to section
3.2
(a)(2)
of this

Title and are affiliated corporations with common officers and a common board
of directors. A licensed pier superintendent or hiring agent may act for one
employer at more than one pier or waterfront terminal, and a single application
will be sufficient for this purpose. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
2.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
